intro: Monotes dasyanthus, commonly known as the rough-leaved monotes, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are yellow and are borne in clusters, making it a distinctive addition to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments.
